intro: Ehretia saligna var. saligna, commonly known as the small-leaved ehretia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, often multi-branched structure and elliptical leaves that are typically 2–5 cm in length. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
